bioghist.p: Hilda ("Jane") Worthington Smith (1888-1984) received her bachelor's and master's degrees from Bryn Mawr College (1910 and 1911, respectively). She was director of the Bryn Mawr Community Center from 1916-1919, and then became dean of of Bryn Mawr College, a post she held from 1919 to 1922. She directed the Bryn Mawr Summer School for Women Workers in Industry from 1921 to 1933. She was a published poet and worked for the government on various worker's education programs.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of the papers of Hilda Smith. Materials include: typed and manuscript poems; letters to Bryn Mawr's Alumnae Association, Helen Hermann, and Elizabeth Freund; clippings about Smith's life; drafts and a published copy of Smith's autobiography, Opening Vistas; copies of one of her books of poems; photocopies of letters from the Smith collection at Harvard's Schlesinger library; a copy of Smith's Women Workers at the Bryn Mawr Summer School; and a brief history of the Bryn Mawr Community Center.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
